name: Static Stretching
description: Post-workout static stretches. Improve flexibility, reduce soreness, aid recovery. Hold gently, don't force.

exercises.name: Standing Hamstring Stretch
exercises.description: Simple hamstring stretch. Hold gently, don't force. Good post-workout or evening routine.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Extend one leg forward, heel on ground, toes up
Keep front leg straight (soft knee okay)
Hinge at hips, lean forward slightly
Feel stretch in back of front leg (hamstring)
Keep back straight, don't round spine
Hold 30-45 seconds, switch legs

modifications.easier: Elevate front foot on low step, reduce range
modifications.harder: Reach towards toes, increase forward lean, hold longer

conditions.hamstring: Gentle stretch okay for chronic tightness, avoid if acute injury
conditions.lower_back: Keep back straight - don't round to reach toes

exercises.name: Standing Quad Stretch
exercises.description: Classic quad stretch. Balance exercise too. Hold wall if needed. Gentle hold, no pulling.
instructions: Stand tall, feet hip-width apart
Bend one knee, grab ankle or foot behind you
Pull heel gently towards butt
Keep knees close together (don't let knee flare out)
Stand tall, don't lean forward
Feel stretch in front of thigh (quad)
Hold wall for balance if needed

modifications.easier: Hold wall for balance, reduce pull on ankle
modifications.harder: Freestanding balance, gentle push hips forward

conditions.knee: Gentle okay for tightness, stop if sharp pain
conditions.hip: Also stretches hip flexors - beneficial for hip tightness

exercises.name: Pigeon Pose
exercises.description: Deep hip stretch from yoga. Intense but beneficial. Good for runners and desk workers. Be patient with this one.
instructions: Start on hands and knees
Bring right knee forward between hands
Extend left leg back, top of foot on floor
Square hips forward - this is key
Walk hands forward, lower chest towards floor
Feel deep stretch in right hip/glute
Hold 30-60 seconds, switch sides

modifications.easier: Place cushion under hip, stay more upright, reduce front shin angle
modifications.harder: Bring front shin more parallel to mat edge, lower chest to floor

conditions.hip: Deep hip stretch - may be intense, build up gradually
conditions.knee: Front knee can be uncomfortable - adjust angle
conditions.lower_back: Can provide lower back relief through hip opening

exercises.name: Child's Pose
exercises.description: Resting yoga pose. Gentle, calming. Perfect for burnout days or recovery. No pressure, just rest.
instructions: Start on hands and knees
Sit hips back towards heels
Extend arms forward on floor
Rest forehead on mat
Let whole body relax and sink
Breathe deeply and slowly
Stay as long as feels good - no rush

modifications.easier: Place cushion under forehead, knees wider apart, sit on heels less
modifications.harder: Walk hands further forward, sink hips deeper

conditions.knee: If uncomfortable kneeling, place blanket under knees
conditions.burnout: Perfect recovery pose - restorative and calming

exercises.name: Seated Forward Fold
exercises.description: Full posterior chain stretch. Hamstrings, calves, back. Don't force - let gravity do the work.
instructions: Sit on floor, legs extended straight in front
Flex feet, toes pointing up
Sit tall, lengthen spine
Hinge at hips, reach hands towards feet
Don't round back - keep spine long
Go only as far as comfortable - feel hamstring stretch
Relax and breathe, let gravity deepen stretch

modifications.easier: Bend knees slightly, use strap around feet, sit on cushion
modifications.harder: Keep legs completely straight, bring chest to thighs, hold longer

conditions.hamstring: Great for chronic tightness, avoid if acute injury
conditions.lower_back: Keep back neutral - don't force round spine to reach toes

exercises.name: Figure-Four Hip Stretch
exercises.description: Deep glute and hip stretch. Lying version of pigeon pose. Easier on knees than pigeon.
instructions: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat on floor
Cross right ankle over left knee
Thread right hand through legs, both hands behind left thigh
Gently pull left thigh towards chest
Feel stretch in right hip/glute
Keep head and shoulders on floor
Hold 30-45 seconds, switch sides

modifications.easier: Keep bottom foot on floor, reduce pull intensity
modifications.harder: Pull knee closer to chest, flex crossed foot

conditions.hip: Excellent hip stretch, especially for runners
conditions.knee: Easier on knees than pigeon pose

exercises.name: Cat-Cow Stretch
exercises.description: Gentle spinal mobility. Perfect morning movement or low-energy days. Feels good, very safe.
instructions: Start on hands and knees, wrists under shoulders
Knees under hips, spine neutral
Inhale: drop belly, lift chest and tailbone (Cow)
Look up gently, open chest
Exhale: round spine, tuck tailbone, drop head (Cat)
Pull belly to spine, push floor away
Flow smoothly between positions, 10 cycles

modifications.easier: Smaller range of motion, slower pace
modifications.harder: Larger range of motion, hold each position longer

conditions.lower_back: Excellent for back stiffness and mobility
conditions.morning_stiffness: Perfect first movement of the day
conditions.wrist: Can rest on forearms if wrists uncomfortable

exercises.name: Chest Doorway Stretch
exercises.description: Opens chest and shoulders. Essential for desk workers. Counteracts forward shoulder posture.
instructions: Stand in doorway, feet staggered for stability
Place forearms on doorframe, elbows at 90 degrees
Elbows at shoulder height
Gently lean forward through doorway
Feel stretch across chest and front of shoulders
Keep core engaged, don't arch lower back
Hold 30-45 seconds

modifications.easier: Reduce forward lean, lower elbow position
modifications.harder: Increase forward lean, hold longer, move elbows higher

conditions.shoulder: Good for shoulder mobility, stop if painful
conditions.desk_posture: Essential stretch for forward shoulder posture

exercises.name: Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.description: Stretches front of hip. Essential for desk workers and runners. Counteracts sitting posture.
instructions: Start in kneeling lunge position
Back knee on floor (use pad if needed)
Front foot flat on floor, knee at 90 degrees
Keep torso upright, engage core
Gently push hips forward
Feel stretch in front of back hip
Hold 30-45 seconds, switch sides

modifications.easier: Reduce forward push, place cushion under back knee
modifications.harder: Reach overhead with same-side arm, increase forward push

conditions.hip: Excellent for hip flexor tightness from sitting
conditions.lower_back: Tight hip flexors can cause lower back pain - this helps
conditions.knee: Pad under back knee if uncomfortable

exercises.name: Seated Spinal Twist
exercises.description: Gentle spinal rotation. Improves thoracic mobility. Feels refreshing for back.
instructions: Sit on floor, legs extended
Bend right knee, place right foot outside left knee
Sit tall, lengthen spine
Twist torso to right, left elbow outside right knee
Right hand behind you for support
Look over right shoulder
Hold 30 seconds, switch sides

modifications.easier: Keep bottom leg straight, reduce twist intensity, sit on cushion
modifications.harder: Deepen twist, bring elbow further around knee

conditions.lower_back: Gentle rotation can feel good, avoid if causes pain

exercises.name: Calf Stretch Against Wall
exercises.description: Stretches calf muscles. Essential for runners. Prevents achilles issues.
instructions: Face wall, hands on wall at shoulder height
Step one foot back, keep it straight
Front knee bent, back leg straight
Keep back heel on ground - this is key
Lean into wall until feel stretch in back calf
Keep back foot pointing forward, not out
Hold 30-45 seconds, switch legs

modifications.easier: Reduce back leg distance, bend back knee slightly
modifications.harder: Step back leg further, hold longer, add gentle pulses

conditions.calf: Essential stretch for calf tightness, avoid if acute strain
conditions.achilles: Helps prevent achilles issues, especially for runners
